DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Related Adverse Event Report Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indictor for the reporting of any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, specifically related to the product or procedure administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the reporting of any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, specifically related to the product or procedure administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Related; connected or associated.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient experienced a
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced any toxicities related to study treatment since the last report?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced any grade >= 2 treatment related adverse event?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have persistent toxicities (> CTCAE grade 2) caused by previous cancer therapy, exclusing alopecia and CTCAE grade 2 peripheral neuropathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient experience any treatment-related adverse events of grade 2 or more per dose modification section?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient experienced any treatment-related adverse events of grade 2 or more per dose modification section with prednisone-equivalent dosing at 10 mg daily or less?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the Patient experienced immune-mediated adverse events requiring dose modification or discontinuation?

DataElement.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Adverse Event Ind-3 (2018376v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1)
